articles.headline: In the Senate, Chasing an Ever-Elusive Gun Law Deal
articles.snippet: After a string of Democratic failures on marquee issues, Senator Chuck Schumer’s decision to give bipartisan gun talks time is a test of the Senate — and of democracy itself.
articles.abstract: After a string of Democratic failures on marquee issues, Senator Chuck Schumer’s decision to give bipartisan gun talks time is a test of the Senate — and of democracy itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The decision of the Senate majority leader, Chuck Schumer of New York, to try for a negotiated compromise on new gun laws in the wake of the latest pair of mass shootings may prove to be a high-stakes bet on representative democracy itself, made at a time when faith in Congress — and the Senate in particular — is in tatters in both parties.

articles.headline: The Arrow in America’s Heart
articles.snippet: Relentless mass shootings, a million dead from Covid — How much do we value a single life?
articles.abstract: Relentless mass shootings, a million dead from Covid — How much do we value a single life?
articles.lead_paragraph: Two days after the massacre of children in Uvalde, Texas, and 12 days after the racist mass killing in Buffalo, Chenxing Han, a chaplain and teacher, told a Buddhist parable.

articles.headline: Wall Street’s Losing Streak Ends, but Uncertainty That Drove It Lingers
articles.snippet: As stocks have tumbled this year, predictions that the selling is over have been wrong time and again.
articles.abstract: As stocks have tumbled this year, predictions that the selling is over have been wrong time and again.
articles.lead_paragraph: The stock market’s staggering run of losses came to an end last week, with the S&P 500 snapping a seven-week losing streak and pulling away from the brink of a bear market with a 6.6 percent bounce through Friday.

articles.headline: After a Bumper 2021, Companies Might Struggle to Increase Profits
articles.snippet: Businesses face headwinds as demand weakens, the Federal Reserve raises rates and government stimulus programs end.
articles.abstract: Businesses face headwinds as demand weakens, the Federal Reserve raises rates and government stimulus programs end.
articles.lead_paragraph: The profits engine that drove stocks to their highs, making many Americans feel richer than they had in a generation, may now be working in reverse.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and Talmon Joseph Smith
